instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.

threads.title: 820 00045 only recognize 1.3GB On SSD
threads.message:
Working on this board with liquid damage around <TRANSISTOR>Q7155</TRANSISTOR>, <CHIP>U8902</CHIP>, <TRANSISTOR>Q5510</TRANSISTOR>. <TRANSISTOR>Q4700</TRANSISTOR>. 

Needed to replace, <TRANSISTOR>Q7155</TRANSISTOR>, <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>, <RESISTOR>R7104</RESISTOR> and <CHIP>U8990</CHIP>. 

This board working fine but can't boot to SSD!! 

[url]https://drive.google.com/file/d/10ChDky5zCeRrAASbXSCjbT-88qv7HWUK/view?usp=sharing[/url]

Suggestions ?? Thank you

threads.title: 820 00045 only recognize 1.3GB On SSD
threads.message: Forget the 1.33Gb part... is the online recovery... the disk are not listed in diskutil.

threads.title: 820 00045 only recognize 1.3GB On SSD
threads.message: Do 5 PRAM in a row and try again...

threads.title: 820 00045 only recognize 1.3GB On SSD
threads.message: Thank you for your reply Aprendiz But same history!! tried 5 times x5PRAM!!! after losing more than 3 days to repair this shit!!! I solve the problem, everything work's excepted SSD! =(

threads.title: 820 00045 only recognize 1.3GB On SSD
threads.message:
Honestly this is a board issue related to the SSD at <CHIP>U8801</CHIP>/10 or the controller at <CHIP>U8400</CHIP>. (Most likely controller).
From what I assume from your screenshot is that the controller is not being detected at all, which could be related to the controller itself but also due to broken internal traces (like PCIe) and resistors failing.

Voltages of:

<SIGNAL>PP1V1_S0SW_SSD</SIGNAL>?
<SIGNAL>PP1V8_S0SW_SSD_HOT</SIGNAL>?
<SIGNAL>PP1V8_S0SW_SSD_COLD</SIGNAL>?
<SIGNAL>PP1V2_S0SW_SSD_HOT</SIGNAL>?
<SIGNAL>PP1V2_S0SW_SSD_COLD</SIGNAL>?
<SIGNAL>PP2V5_S0SW_SSD</SIGNAL>?
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0SW_S1X</SIGNAL>
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0SW_SSD</SIGNAL>?


These boards are a pain in the ass to work with and if these voltages all are OK you might be in for a hard time

threads.title: 820 00045 only recognize 1.3GB On SSD
threads.message:
Smiba Greetings!!! ty for your reply!! I already solve the problem!! the problem was on <CHIP>U8902</CHIP>!!! Pin 1 was not connect to the board because the liquid! only see under Scoope!! i was only have 0.345V on <SIGNAL>PP1V8_S0SW_SSD_HOT</SIGNAL> !! Resolder the component, now i have 1.78V and SSD work's Fine 

Thank you aprendiz and smiba!!
